data.question: Does the ion exchange process of compound 1 with Pb(II) ions occur without losing single crystallinity?
What is the percentage of Cd(II) replaced by Pb(II) within 2 hours during the ion exchange process?

How long does the reverse ion exchange process from Pb(II) to Cd(II) take to complete?

Was the framework of compound 1 successfully exchanged with lanthanide ions without losing crystallinity?
What is the charge of the frameworks of compounds 3 and 4?
Does the cubic framework of compound 1 remain the same after the exchange with lanthanide ions?
What is the Langmuir surface area of compound 1?
Is the BET surface area of compound 3 less than that of compound 1?
What is the total pore volume of compound 4?
Did the ion exchange process of compound 1 with Pb(II) ions result in a change in the powder X-ray diffraction pattern?
What was observed in the powder X-ray diffraction pattern of compound 1 after 20 and 30 minutes of soaking in lead nitrate solution?
data.answer: A splitting of the peak corresponding to the (200) plane

data.question: Was the splitting of the (200) peak observed in the reverse ion exchange process from compound 2 to 1?
What does the splitting of the (200) plane in the PXRD pattern during ion exchange indicate?
data.answer: A significant structural change in the planes containing the square-planar {M4O} units

data.question: Is the ion exchange process of compound 1 with Dy(III) ions faster than with Nd(III) ions?
data.answer: The text does not provide specific rates to compare the speed of exchange between Dy(III) and Nd(III) ions.
